segment.source: Microsoft Edge works with Group Policy and Microsoft Intune to help you manage your organization's computer settings.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge works with Group Policy and Microsoft Intune to help you manage your organization's computer settings.

segment.source: Group Policy objects (GPO's) can include registry-based Administrative Template policy settings, security settings, software deployment information, scripts, folder redirection, and preferences.
segment.target: Group Policy objects (GPO's) can include registry-based Administrative Template policy settings, security settings, software deployment information, scripts, folder redirection, and preferences.

segment.source: By using Group Policy and Intune, you can set up a policy setting once, and then copy that setting onto many computers.
segment.target: By using Group Policy and Intune, you can set up a policy setting once, and then copy that setting onto many computers.

segment.source: For example, you can set up multiple security settings in a GPO that's linked to a domain, and then apply all of those settings to every computer in the domain.
segment.target: For example, you can set up multiple security settings in a GPO that's linked to a domain, and then apply all of those settings to every computer in the domain.

segment.source: For more info about Group Policy, see the Group Policy TechCenter.
segment.target: For more info about Group Policy, see the Group Policy TechCenter.

segment.source: This site provides links to the latest technical documentation, videos, and downloads for Group Policy.
segment.target: This site provides links to the latest technical documentation, videos, and downloads for Group Policy.

segment.source: For more info about the tools you can use to change your Group Policy objects, see the Internet Explorer 11 topics, Group Policy and the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), Group Policy and the Local Group Policy Editor, Group Policy and the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), and Group Policy and Windows Powershell.
segment.target: For more info about the tools you can use to change your Group Policy objects, see the Internet Explorer 11 topics, Group Policy and the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), Group Policy and the Local Group Policy Editor, Group Policy and the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), and Group Policy and Windows Powershell.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge works with these Group Policy settings \(\) to help you manage your company's web browser configurations:
segment.target: Microsoft Edge works with these Group Policy settings \(\) to help you manage your company's web browser configurations:

segment.source: Allow employees to send Do Not Track headers
segment.target: Allow employees to send Do Not Track headers

segment.source: Whether employees can send Do Not Track headers to websites that request tracking info.
segment.target: Whether employees can send Do Not Track headers to websites that request tracking info.

segment.source: Enable: Employees can send Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.
segment.target: Enable: Employees can send Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Stops employees from sending Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Stops employees from sending Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.

segment.source: Turn off web content in new tab page
segment.target: Turn off web content in new tab page

segment.source: Decide what Microsoft Edge shows when opening a new tab.
segment.target: Decide what Microsoft Edge shows when opening a new tab.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can see the new tab page with Top Sites, Top Sites with suggested content, or a blank page.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can see the new tab page with Top Sites, Top Sites with suggested content, or a blank page.

segment.source: Disable: Employees see an empty tab and are unable to change the Open new tabs with setting.
segment.target: Disable: Employees see an empty tab and are unable to change the Open new tabs with setting.

segment.source: Decide how your company deals with cookies.
segment.target: Decide how your company deals with cookies.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Lets you decide how your company treats cookies.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Lets you decide how your company treats cookies.

segment.source: If you use this option, you must also choose whether to Allow all cookies (default), Block all cookies, or Block only 3rd-party cookies.
segment.target: If you use this option, you must also choose whether to Allow all cookies (default), Block all cookies, or Block only 3rd-party cookies.

segment.source: Disable: Allows all cookies from all websites.
segment.target: Disable: Allows all cookies from all websites.

segment.source: Choose which corporate Home pages should appear for domain-joined devices.
segment.target: Choose which corporate Home pages should appear for domain-joined devices.

segment.source: Enable: Configure corporate Home pages for domain-joined devices.
segment.target: Enable: Configure corporate Home pages for domain-joined devices.

segment.source: If you use this option, you must also include site URLs.
segment.target: If you use this option, you must also include site URLs.

segment.source: Note: You must use this format and the angle brackets if you have multiple pages.
segment.target: Note: You must use this format and the angle brackets if you have multiple pages.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Uses the corporate Home pages and URLs specified in the App settings.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Uses the corporate Home pages and URLs specified in the App settings.

segment.source: Configure the Enterprise Mode Site List
segment.target: Configure the Enterprise Mode Site List

segment.source: Whether your company uses Enterprise Mode and the Enterprise Mode Site List to address common compatibility problems with legacy apps.
segment.target: Whether your company uses Enterprise Mode and the Enterprise Mode Site List to address common compatibility problems with legacy apps.

segment.source: Enable: Lets you use the Enterprise Mode Site List to address common compatibility problems with legacy apps, if it’s configured.
segment.target: Enable: Lets you use the Enterprise Mode Site List to address common compatibility problems with legacy apps, if it’s configured.

segment.source: If you use this option, you must also add the location to your site list in the {URI} box.
segment.target: If you use this option, you must also add the location to your site list in the {URI} box.

segment.source: When configured, any site on the list will always open in IE11.
segment.target: When configured, any site on the list will always open in IE11.

segment.source: Disable or not configured: You won't be able to use the Enterprise Mode Site List.
segment.target: Disable or not configured: You won't be able to use the Enterprise Mode Site List.

segment.source: Decide what sites appear on the default Favorites list.
segment.target: Decide what sites appear on the default Favorites list.

segment.source: Enable: Configure the default list of Favorite sites for your employees.
segment.target: Enable: Configure the default list of Favorite sites for your employees.

segment.source: If you use this option, you must also add the actual names and URLs for the sites.
segment.target: If you use this option, you must also add the actual names and URLs for the sites.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Uses the Favorites list names and URLs specified in the Favorites hub.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Uses the Favorites list names and URLs specified in the Favorites hub.

segment.source: Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides
segment.target: Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides

segment.source: Whether employees can override the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially malicious websites.
segment.target: Whether employees can override the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially malicious websites.

segment.source: Enable: Stops employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings and blocks them from visiting the site.
segment.target: Enable: Stops employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings and blocks them from visiting the site.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Lets employees ignore the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially malicious sites and continue to the site.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Lets employees ignore the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially malicious sites and continue to the site.

segment.source: Note: You can also turn on the SmartScreen Filter, using the Turn off the SmartScreen Filter setting and stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about unverified file downloads, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides for unverified files setting.
segment.target: Note: You can also turn on the SmartScreen Filter, using the Turn off the SmartScreen Filter setting and stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about unverified file downloads, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides for unverified files setting.

segment.source: Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides for unverified files
segment.target: Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides for unverified files

segment.source: Whether employees can override the SmartScreen Filter warnings about downloading unverified files.
segment.target: Whether employees can override the SmartScreen Filter warnings about downloading unverified files.

segment.source: Enable: Stops employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings and stops them from downloading unverified files.
segment.target: Enable: Stops employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings and stops them from downloading unverified files.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Lets employees ignore the SmartScreen Filter warnings about unverified files and lets them continue the download process.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Lets employees ignore the SmartScreen Filter warnings about unverified files and lets them continue the download process.

segment.source: Note: You can also turn on the SmartScreen Filter, using the Turn off the SmartScreen Filter setting and stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially dangerous websites, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides setting.
segment.target: Note: You can also turn on the SmartScreen Filter, using the Turn off the SmartScreen Filter setting and stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially dangerous websites, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides setting.

segment.source: Don't allow WebRTC to share the LocalHost IP address
segment.target: Don't allow WebRTC to share the LocalHost IP address

segment.source: Whether an employee’s LocalHost IP address shows while using the WebRTC protocol
segment.target: Whether an employee’s LocalHost IP address shows while using the WebRTC protocol

segment.source: Enable: Hides the LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.
segment.target: Enable: Hides the LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Shows the LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Shows the LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.

segment.source: Send all intranet sites to IE11
segment.target: Send all intranet sites to IE11

segment.source: Whether your intranet sites should all open using IE11.
segment.target: Whether your intranet sites should all open using IE11.

segment.source: Important: This setting should only be used if there are known compatibility problems with Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Important: This setting should only be used if there are known compatibility problems with Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Enable: Automatically opens all intranet sites using IE11.
segment.target: Enable: Automatically opens all intranet sites using IE11.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Automatically opens all intranet sites using Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Automatically opens all intranet sites using Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Turn off Address bar search suggestions
segment.target: Turn off Address bar search suggestions

segment.source: Whether search suggestions should appear in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Whether search suggestions should appear in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Disable: Employees can’t see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Disable: Employees can’t see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Whether employees can use Autofill to automatically fill in form fields while using Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Whether employees can use Autofill to automatically fill in form fields while using Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can use Autofill to complete form fields.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can use Autofill to complete form fields.

segment.source: Disable: Employees can’t use Autofill to complete form fields.
segment.target: Disable: Employees can’t use Autofill to complete form fields.

segment.source: Whether employees can browse using InPrivate website browsing.
segment.target: Whether employees can browse using InPrivate website browsing.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Shows the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Shows the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Disable: Hides the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Disable: Hides the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Whether the F12 Developer Tools are available on Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Whether the F12 Developer Tools are available on Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Lets employees use InPrivate browsing while on the corporate network.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Lets employees use InPrivate browsing while on the corporate network.

segment.source: Disable: Stops employees from using inPrivate browsing on the corporate network.
segment.target: Disable: Stops employees from using inPrivate browsing on the corporate network.

segment.source: Whether employees can save their passwords locally, using Password Manager.
segment.target: Whether employees can save their passwords locally, using Password Manager.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can use Password Manager to save passwords locally.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Employees can use Password Manager to save passwords locally.

segment.source: Disable: Employees can't use Password Manager to save passwords locally.
segment.target: Disable: Employees can't use Password Manager to save passwords locally.

segment.source: Whether to turn on Pop-up Blocker and allow pop-ups to appear in secondary windows.
segment.target: Whether to turn on Pop-up Blocker and allow pop-ups to appear in secondary windows.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Turns on Pop-up Blocker, stopping pop-up windows.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Turns on Pop-up Blocker, stopping pop-up windows.

segment.source: Disable: Turns off Pop-up Blocker, allowing pop-up windows.
segment.target: Disable: Turns off Pop-up Blocker, allowing pop-up windows.

segment.source: Whether to turn on SmartScreen Filter to help protect your employees from potential phishing scams and malicious software.
segment.target: Whether to turn on SmartScreen Filter to help protect your employees from potential phishing scams and malicious software.

segment.source: Enable or not configured (default): Turns on SmartScreen Filter, providing warning messages to your employees about potential phishing scams and malicious software.
segment.target: Enable or not configured (default): Turns on SmartScreen Filter, providing warning messages to your employees about potential phishing scams and malicious software.

segment.source: Note: You can also stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially dangerous websites, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides setting and stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about unverified file downloads, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides for unverified files setting.
segment.target: Note: You can also stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially dangerous websites, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides setting and stop employees from ignoring the SmartScreen Filter warnings about unverified file downloads, using the Don’t allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides for unverified files setting.

segment.source: Using Microsoft Intune to manage your Mobile Data Management (MDM) settings for Microsoft Edge
segment.target: Using Microsoft Intune to manage your Mobile Data Management (MDM) settings for Microsoft Edge

segment.source: If you manage your policies using Intune, you'll want to use these MDM policy settings:
segment.target: If you manage your policies using Intune, you'll want to use these MDM policy settings:

segment.source: The Supports column uses these options:
segment.target: The Supports column uses these options:

segment.source: Supports Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise computers that are enrolled with Intune only.
segment.target: Supports Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise computers that are enrolled with Intune only.

segment.source: Supports both desktop and mobile devices.
segment.target: Supports both desktop and mobile devices.

segment.source: All devices must be enrolled with Intune if you want to use the Windows Custom URI Policy.
segment.target: All devices must be enrolled with Intune if you want to use the Windows Custom URI Policy.

segment.source: 0. Employees can’t use Autofill to complete form fields.
segment.target: 0. Employees can’t use Autofill to complete form fields.

segment.source: Employees can use Autofill to complete form fields.
segment.target: Employees can use Autofill to complete form fields.

segment.source: 0. Employees can't use the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: 0. Employees can't use the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Employees can use the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Employees can use the F12 Developer Tools on Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Stops employees from sending Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.
segment.target: Stops employees from sending Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.

segment.source: 1. Employees can send Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.
segment.target: 1. Employees can send Do Not Track headers to websites requesting tracking info.

segment.source: 0. Employees can use InPrivate browsing sessions.
segment.target: 0. Employees can use InPrivate browsing sessions.

segment.source: Employees can't use InPrivate Browsing sessions.
segment.target: Employees can't use InPrivate Browsing sessions.

segment.source: Microsoft Edge doesn't use IE Zone configuration for intranet sites.
segment.target: Microsoft Edge doesn't use IE Zone configuration for intranet sites.

segment.source: 1. Microsoft Edge uses IE Zone configuration for intranet sites.
segment.target: 1. Microsoft Edge uses IE Zone configuration for intranet sites.

segment.source: Employees can use Password Manager to save passwords locally.
segment.target: Employees can use Password Manager to save passwords locally.

segment.source: 1. Employees can't use Password Manager to save passwords locally.
segment.target: 1. Employees can't use Password Manager to save passwords locally.

segment.source: Turns off Pop-up Blocker, stopping pop-up windows
segment.target: Turns off Pop-up Blocker, stopping pop-up windows

segment.source: 1. Turns on Pop-up Blocker, allowing pop-up windows.
segment.target: 1. Turns on Pop-up Blocker, allowing pop-up windows.

segment.source: Employees can see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Employees can see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: 1. Employees can’t see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: 1. Employees can’t see search suggestions in the Address bar of Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Turns on SmartScreen Filter, providing warning messages to your employees about potential phishing scams and malicious software.
segment.target: Turns on SmartScreen Filter, providing warning messages to your employees about potential phishing scams and malicious software.

segment.source: Open a new tab with a new tab page.
segment.target: Open a new tab with a new tab page.

segment.source: Allow all cookies from all sites.
segment.target: Allow all cookies from all sites.

segment.source: 2. Block all cookies from all sites.
segment.target: 2. Block all cookies from all sites.

segment.source: 1. Use Enterprise Mode site list, if configured.
segment.target: 1. Use Enterprise Mode site list, if configured.

segment.source: 2. Specify the location to the site list.
segment.target: 2. Specify the location to the site list.

segment.source: Note: URLs must be on separate lines.
segment.target: Note: URLs must be on separate lines.

segment.source: Employees can ignore SmartScreen warnings for files.
segment.target: Employees can ignore SmartScreen warnings for files.

segment.source: 1. Employees can't override SmartScreen warnings for files.
segment.target: 1. Employees can't override SmartScreen warnings for files.

segment.source: Shows an employee's LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.
segment.target: Shows an employee's LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.

segment.source: 1. Hides an employee's LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.
segment.target: 1. Hides an employee's LocalHost IP address while using the WebRTC protocol.

segment.source: These are additional Windows 10-specific Group Policy settings that work with Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: These are additional Windows 10-specific Group Policy settings that work with Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Enable or not configured: Employees can use Cortana on their devices.
segment.target: Enable or not configured: Employees can use Cortana on their devices.

segment.source: Disable: Stops employees from using Cortana on their devices.
segment.target: Disable: Stops employees from using Cortana on their devices.

segment.source: Note: Employees can still perform searches even with Cortana turned off.
segment.target: Note: Employees can still perform searches even with Cortana turned off.

segment.source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\sync your settings\Do not sync
segment.target: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\sync your settings\Do not sync

segment.source: Whether employees can use the Sync your Settings options to sync their settings to and from their device.
segment.target: Whether employees can use the Sync your Settings options to sync their settings to and from their device.

segment.source: Enable: Turns off the Sync your Settings options and none of the Sync your Setting groups are synced on the device.
segment.target: Enable: Turns off the Sync your Settings options and none of the Sync your Setting groups are synced on the device.

segment.source: You can use the Allow users to turn syncing on option to turn the feature off by default, but to let the employee change this setting.
segment.target: You can use the Allow users to turn syncing on option to turn the feature off by default, but to let the employee change this setting.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Turns on the Sync your Settings area by default, letting employees pick what can sync on their device.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Turns on the Sync your Settings area by default, letting employees pick what can sync on their device.

segment.source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\sync your settings\Do not sync browser settings
segment.target: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\sync your settings\Do not sync browser settings

segment.source: Whether a browser group can use the Sync your Settings options to sync their info to and from their device.
segment.target: Whether a browser group can use the Sync your Settings options to sync their info to and from their device.

segment.source: This includes settings and info like History and Favorites.
segment.target: This includes settings and info like History and Favorites.

segment.source: Enable: Turns off the Sync your Settings options so that browser groups are unable to sync their settings and info.
segment.target: Enable: Turns off the Sync your Settings options so that browser groups are unable to sync their settings and info.

segment.source: You can use the Allow users to turn browser syncing on option to turn the feature off by default, but to let the employee change this setting.
segment.target: You can use the Allow users to turn browser syncing on option to turn the feature off by default, but to let the employee change this setting.

segment.source: Disable or not configured (default): Turns on the Sync your Settings area by default, letting browser groups pick what can sync on their device.
segment.target: Disable or not configured (default): Turns on the Sync your Settings area by default, letting browser groups pick what can sync on their device.

segment.source: These are additional Windows 10-specific MDM policy settings that work with Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: These are additional Windows 10-specific MDM policy settings that work with Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: 0. Employees can’t use Cortana on their devices.
segment.target: 0. Employees can’t use Cortana on their devices.

segment.source: Employees can use Cortana on their devices.
segment.target: Employees can use Cortana on their devices.

segment.source: 0. Employees can’t sync settings between PCs.
segment.target: 0. Employees can’t sync settings between PCs.
